unit.doc: Portable Lwt implementation of HTTP client and server, without depending on a particular I/O implementation. The various Make functors must be instantiated by an implementation that provides a concrete IO monad.

module_type.doc: The Net module type defines how to connect to a remote node and close the resulting channels to clean up.
The Request module combines the CohttpRequest module with the IO functions, to have them conveniently in one place.

module.doc: Functor to build a concrete Cohttp_lwtRequest from an IO implementation

module_type.doc: The Response module combines the CohttpRequest module with the IO functions, to have them conveniently in one place.

module.doc: Functor to build a concrete Cohttp_lwtResponse from an IO implementation

module_type.doc: The Client module implements non-pipelined single HTTP client calls. Each call will open a separate Cohttp_lwtNet connection. For best results, the Cohttp_lwt_body that is returned should be consumed in order to close the file descriptor in a timely fashion. It will still be finalized by a GC hook if it is not used up, but this can take some additional time to happen.

value.doc: call ?ctx ?headers ?body ?chunked meth uri will resolve the uri to a concrete network endpoint using the resolver initialized in ctx. It will then issue an HTTP request with method meth, adding request headers from headers if present. If a body is specified then that will be included with the request, using chunked encoding if chunked is true. The default is to disable chunked encoding for HTTP request bodies for compatibility reasons.In most cases you should use the more specific helper calls in the interface rather than invoke this function directly. See Cohttp_lwtClienthead, Cohttp_lwtClientget and Cohttp_lwtClientpost for some examples.

module.doc: The Make_client functor glues together a CohttpSIO implementation with CohttpRequest and CohttpResponse to send requests down a connection that is established by the Cohttp_lwtNet module. The resulting module satisfies the Cohttp_lwtClient module type.

module_type.doc: The Server module implements a pipelined HTTP/1.1 server.

value.doc: Resolve a URI and a docroot into a concrete local filename.

respond ?headers ?flush ~status ~body will respond to an HTTP request with the given status code and response body. If flush is true, then every response chunk will be flushed to the network rather than being buffered. flush is true by default.

module.doc: The Make_server functor glues together a CohttpSIO implementation with CohttpRequest and CohttpResponse to send requests down a connection that is established by the Cohttp_lwtNet module. The resulting module satisfies the Cohttp_lwtServer module type.
